revision.comment: /* top */http→https for [[Google Books]] and [[Google News]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{italic title}} The '''''Naval Chronicle''''' was a British periodical published monthly between January, 1799 and December, 1818 (Huntington). It contained information about the [[Royal Navy of the United Kingdom]], including biographies, histories, news, and essays on [[nautical]] subjects, as well as poems and ballads on a variety of related topics (Jeffery).
The founders were [[James Stanier Clarke]] and [[John McArthur (purser)|John McArthur]],<ref>{{cite DNB|wstitle=Clarke, James Stanier|volume=10}}</ref> and the editorial staff included [[Stephen Jones (editor)|Stephen Jones]] and his brother John Jones (father of [[John Winter Jones]]).<ref >{{cite book|author=Freemasons' magazine|title=The Freemasons' quarterly (magazine and) review [afterw.] The Freemasons' monthly magazine. [Continued as] The Freemasons' magazine and masonic mirror|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iU0FAAAAQAAJ&pg=PA249|accessdate=4 September 2013|year=1871|page=249}}</ref> Contributors included [[Francis Gibson]],<ref>{{cite ODNB|id=10617|title=Gibson, Francis|first=Anita|last=McConnell}}</ref> and [[Charles Vinicombe Penrose]] under initials as pseudonyms.<ref>{{cite ODNB|id=21888|title=Penrose, Charles Vinicombe|first=Christopher D.|last=Hall}}</ref> [[Nicholas Pocock]] provided a long series of illustrations.<ref>{{cite ODNB|id=22425|title=Pocock, Nicholas|first=David|last=Cordingly}}</ref>
